alert.note: Alert for East Platte County; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:40PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Platte County through 830 PM MDT... At 740 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sibley Peak, or 27 miles north of Wheatland, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glendo, Sibley Peak, Glendo Reservoir and Two Moon Campground. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 101 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: East Platte County; North Laramie Range
